properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for the formation of frost tonight, especially in low lying inland areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-19T10:29:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T18:30:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2610264894.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Clear skies and light winds will allow ground temperatures to cool to near or below zero over many regions of the Maritimes tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T16:49:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T00:50:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1554695345.2019
Area: Kings County P.E.I., Queens County P.E.I., Prince County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop under the freezing mark locally over these regions tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog with visibilities less than 400 metres will persist at Coral Harbour most of the night, but should start thinning out towards morning as west winds gradually strengthen. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T14:09:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T03:28:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0656776305.2019
Area: Coral Harbour

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain associated with a low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue in Cape Dorset and Kimmirut tonight. Total rainfall amounts of anywhere from 25 to 40 mm are expected by the time the rain tapers off during the day on Thursday. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T18:43:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T02:44:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1567748943.2019
Area: Kimmirut, Cape Dorset
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds with gusts up to 100 km/h will affect these areas tonight. They will gradually diminish late overnight and Thursday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T18:57:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T02:58:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3711902039.2019
Area: Salluit, Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Hurricane Humberto. The next information statement will be issued by 09:00 a.m. ADT. Humberto affected Bermuda with winds gusting to 185 km/h. The storm will approach Canadian marine waters tonight into Friday, affecting the Scotian Slope. Humberto will affect the southern Grand Banks on Saturday. 1. Summary of basic information at 03:00 a.m. ADT. Location: Near 34.8 North 62.8 West. About 320 kilometres north-northeast of Bermuda. Maximum sustained winds: 195 kilometres per hour. Present movement: Northeast at 37 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 952 millibars. 2. Public weather impacts and warnings summary. No significant effects are expected over land. a. Wind. No significant wind expected. b. Rainfall. No significant rain expected. c. Surge/Waves. Swells of 2 to 3 metres may reach the Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia Friday, and 3 to 5 metres swells may reach southern Newfoundland during the weekend. 3. Marine weather impacts and warnings summary. Gale to Storm Force winds are forecast over the Scotian Slope waters, Laurentian Fan and Banquereau Friday into Saturday. Humberto will then affect the southern Grand Banks on Saturday. As the winds increase, large waves of 6 to 9 metres will build over offshore waters. Some of these waves could exceed 10 metres southeast of the track as the centre passes over extreme southern Laurentian Fan and the southern Grand Banks. Forecaster(s): Hatt. ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-20T11:35:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T05:36:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3983736129.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada
